summary: This is an automatic out-of-office email reply from a federal prosecutor (AUSA) indicating they are traveling for work and may have delayed email responses. It references the 'Proposed Epstein Victims' Compensation Program' and suggests contacting other AUSAs on the case for urgent matters.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: The author of the automatic out-of-office email reply, who is traveling for work and handling the Epstein case.

events.title: Automatic Reply Regarding Epstein Victims' Compensation Program
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) sets an automatic out-of-office reply while traveling, referencing the Proposed Epstein Victims' Compensation Program and directing urgent case matters to other AUSAs.

keyFacts: The document is an automatic out-of-office email reply dated December 13, 2019.
It references the 'Proposed Epstein Victims' Compensation Program', indicating ongoing legal proceedings related to victim compensation.
The email is from a federal prosecutor (AUSA) who is traveling for work and handling the Epstein case.
It directs urgent matters to other Assistant U.S. Attorneys on the case, suggesting a team is involved in the prosecution.
